column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0003] Recently, users are turning to more sophisticated personal digital assistants (PDAs) rather than more basic network-connected devices such as cell phones.
#Text=Mobile phones that have the capability to send and receive data via data subscriptions to a network have become more prevalent.
#Text=The capabilities of these mobile phones, often referred to as "smart phones", have led to them being viewed more as mobile computers rather than simplistic communication devices.
#Text=Smart phones also often feature short range wireless transmitters and protocols, such as Bluetooth, specifically designed for communicating with other devices or accessories nearby.
#Text=[0004] Bluetooth watches in the past have been provided which support caller ID and text messages.
#Text=However, the information it displayed was brief as it was limited to a one-line display.
#Text=[0005] There exists a method for synchronizing data between a watch and an external digital device as described in U.S.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=No. 6,977,868 to Brewer et al.
#Text=This method requires the user to initiate the synchronization by contacting the watch display, which causes the microprocessor in the watch to activate and begin the synchronization process.
#Text=Consequently, the user is not able to instantly check for new data by looking at the watch.
#Text=The user must wait for the microprocessor to activate and complete the synchronization process prior to the information being displayed.
#Text=This also means that the user may not receive new data in a timely manner, since this technology does not notify the user when there are updates available.
#Text=Furthermore, this solution can require an "alignment device" to aid the wireless communication link between a watch and PDA.
#Text=In this case, a high level of user interaction is required.
#Text=Furthermore, the communication is a synchronization, which lengthens the time the wireless communication is active and negatively impacts battery life.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=No. 6,714,486 to Biggs teaches a system and method for customized time display.
#Text=Biggs is concerned with displaying time and other chronological data on a display of a portable timepiece.
#Text=However, the data is sent to the display as image parameter data rather than raw text.
#Text=The disadvantage of this is that a more complex hardware design is needed to support the memory required for storing and displaying image data.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=No. 6,118,979 to Powell teaches a method of indicating an incoming call through a remotely located receiving device.
#Text=This avoids situations where a cell phone would audibly ring at the same time as the external device vibrates, as they both indicate the same event of an incoming call.
#Text=However, this solution only concerns the signalling of incoming telephone calls by an external device.
#Text=There exists a switch for whether the incoming call is connected or disconnected to the audible signalling system of the transmitter.
